Activities commonly implemented under this intervention

Select for improved genetics within the existing herd.
Develop breeding programs with exotic and local genetic resources.

Guidance for increased environmental sustainability

P3. Improving livestock genetics already contributes to sustainability by avoiding GHG emissions and pressure on natural resources associated with less-productive animals (reproductive herd as well as fattening/milking animals). FAO 2010, IAEA 2007.
P4. Cross-breeding with high-productivity breeds may require more and higher-quality feed, production of which may increase environmental impacts. Ensure that any increased demand for higher-quality feed is met sustainably. LEAP 2016b.
P3. Consider the effect of breed improvement and the reduction of herd size on the resilience of the system to deal with short- and long-term perturbations, such as droughts, floods, warfare, and climate change.
